google_search.query: How to get free school meals

results.title: Free school meals | East Sussex County Council
results.snippet: Your child gets free school meals if they're in Reception, Year 1, or Year 2. You do not need to apply for them. If you get certain benefits, you should apply.

results.title: Free School Meals - The Stopping Place
results.snippet: School dinners can be a good way for your child to have a healthy lunch. Lots of children eat things at school that they refuse to eat at home because they see ...

results.title: Eligibility for free school meals | Czone
results.snippet: Children must attend school both before and after the lunch period to receive a free meal. Some pupils who are over 16 may receive a qualifying benefit in ...

results.title: Apply for low-income families | East Sussex County Council
results.snippet: Your child may be able to get free transport to school if: your family gets the maximum Universal Credit; your child gets free school meals. Before sending ...

results.title: Free school meals
results.snippet: We work with Chartwells to serve 15,000 meals each day. 95% of meals are made fresh at the schools that have kitchens. If a school doesn't have a kitchen, ...

results.title: Free school transport - low family income | East Sussex County ...
results.snippet: We supply transport to get children between their home and school. But only for the timetabled school day. At other times, you will have to make your own ...

results.title: Food | East Sussex County Council
results.snippet: Details of food banks, food partnerships and other services that offer discounts or free food. Families who receive free school meals are also eligible for ...

results.title: Welcome to Holiday food and fun | East Sussex County Council
results.snippet: It's free for school-aged children and young people who receive benefits-related free school meals. A small number of places are available for other eligible ...

results.title: Synergy Web

results.title: Synergy - Enquiry
